required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serological Response to Porcine Circovirus Type 1 (PCV-1) and PCV-1 DNA in Stools of Infants Following Administration of Rotarix™
clinical_study.official_title: Blinded Retrospective Laboratory Evaluations to Assess the Serologic Response to Porcine Circovirus Type 1 (PCV-1) and PCV-1 DNA in the Stool of Infants Aged 6 to 12 Weeks Following Administration of GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) Biologicals' Oral Live Attenuated Human Rotavirus Vaccine (444563)

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to test the clinical samples (stool and serum) previously collected during clinical development of HRV vaccine, to identify if there is any evidence of PCV-1 replication and/or immune response to the PCV-1 in vaccinated infants.

detailed_description.textblock: Serum and stool samples collected from 4 clinical trials previously conducted for HRV vaccine (Rotarix™) are used in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of PCV-1 DNA and pattern of detection in the stool samples collected
primary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-defined time points after vaccination (3-7 time points up to day 45 after vaccination)
At pre and post vaccination time points (At Day 0 and 2 Months after last dose vaccination)

clinical_study.condition: Evidence of PCV-1 Replication and/or Immune Response to the PCV-1 in HRV Vaccinated Infants

arm_group.description: Subjects received two or three doses of HRV in previous studies.
Subjects received two or three doses of placebo in previous studies.

intervention.description: Stool samples collected at pre-determined time points in previous studies will be analysed to detect the presence of PCV-1 DNA and pattern of detection.
Serum samples collected at pre and post vaccination time points in previous studies will be assessed for Anti-PCV-1 antibody.

study_pop.textblock: Infants aged 6 to 12 weeks from 4 previously conducted clinical trials, who received 2 or 3 doses of either Rotarix™ or Placebo
